instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test.  iv tried restarting many times but no change.  i made a video but had to convert it to images (its about 20 sec of video) because idk if i can upload videos or not? if so what file type? i have yet to run asd tests so i will run it as soon as i can get to it and will update if i get any info there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: looks like a problem with your LVDS cable. Whats it like on external ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: [USER="461"]Gurmon[/USER]  You say LVDS Cable? but this is on a working test screen. it does this on multiple screens, but i did not test external at the time (now im thinking why didnt i hahah)  perhaps LVDS connector on the board is likely

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: If the lvds connector is fine, then i would suspect the GPU mux. Also check out <CHIP>U9270</CHIP> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: Does it boot fully in OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: Yes it does. and if i move the screen up or down it makes dif lines and changes colors. it seemed to not be switching colors on this test screen but mess up the color if you move the screen.  and i would think that it is the screen is how it makes me feel but i plug a working board into it and it works normal so i cant be the screen. could it be the lvds connector on the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: Press on <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> on see if that affects the problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: pressed on the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, nothing changed.  but it does have some nasty looking probe points around the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  Display is flashing between colors like as if it was in a ASD video test
threads.message: The colors changing when you move the screen is probably and indicator of a bad LCD connector or one of the coils in the LVDS lines near the LCD connector. Poke around the LCD connector and see if anything reacts.
